name: 4-[5-Methoxy-3-(5-methyl-furan-2-yl)-benzofuran-2-yl]-butan-2-one
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3874
Reason: 4-[5-Methoxy-3-(5-methyl-furan-2-yl)-benzofuran-2-yl]-butan-2-one has a melting point that we will compare to benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C (according to the CRC Handbook of Chemistry and Physics, 49th Edition, 1968-1969). The structural modifications we need to consider are the presence of a methoxy group, a furan ring, and a methyl group. The methoxy group introduces a hydroxyl group, which can participate in hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by approximately +5°C. The furan ring introduces a rigid structure and potential hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +20°C. The methyl group adds approximately +5°C due to its small size and limited impact on the overall structure.
